abstract: The nation’s largest education lender agreed to be sold to JP Morgan Chase, Bank of America and two private equity firms.
snippet: The nation’s largest education lender agreed to be sold to JP Morgan Chase, Bank of America and two private equity firms.
lead_paragraph: Sallie Mae agreed late last night to be sold to JP Morgan Chase, Bank of America and two private equity firms for $25 billion, said people involved in the negotiations.

headline.main: Negotiators Say Sallie Mae to Be Sold for $25 Billion
headline.print_headline: Embattled Sallie Mae to Be Sold For $25 Billion, Negotiators Say

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Jennifer 8. Lee

abstract: Despite continuing fallout from subprime loans and clouds over the U.S. economy, three banking giants are expected to report relatively strong first-quarter earnings this week, according to MarketWatch. On tap are J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America and Citigroup, which ast week unveiled a restructuring plan that would eliminate about 17,000 jobs worldwide and save the company an estimated $1.7 billion this year.
lead_paragraph: Despite continuing fallout from subprime loans and clouds over the U.S. economy, three banking giants are expected to report relatively strong first-quarter earnings this week, according to MarketWatch. On tap are J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America and Citigroup, which ast week unveiled a restructuring plan that would eliminate about 17,000 jobs worldwide and save the company an estimated $1.7 billion this year.

headline.main: Big Banks Are Set for Strong 1st-Quarter Earnings

abstract: Sallie Mae agreed late last night to be sold to J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America and two private equity firms for $25 billion. The deal, announced early Monday, would move the nation’s largest education lender, officially known as the SLM Corporation, into private control amid increasing turmoil for the company.
lead_paragraph: Sallie Mae agreed late last night to be sold to J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America and two private equity firms for $25 billion. The deal, announced early Monday, would move the nation’s largest education lender, officially known as the SLM Corporation, into private control amid increasing turmoil for the company.

headline.main: Sallie Mae Agrees to Be Sold for $25 Billion
